title: FBI sent alert before Texas shooting
description: The FBI had warned Texas officials several hours before a provocative cartoon contest that a suspected extremist could show up at the event.

title: US to investigate Baltimore police
description: The US justice department is to investigate Baltimore's police for routine bias or excessive force after the death of Freddie Gray, US media say.

title: US phone data collection 'illegal'
description: A US appeals court rules that bulk collection of phone records by the National Security Agency is illegal.

title: Canada releases ex-Guantanamo inmate
description: A Canadian court releases on bail an ex-Guantanamo Bay detainee after refusing a final effort by the government to keep him imprisoned.

title: Barack Obama mends a broken heart
description: Until now the president has never been to South Dakota, prompting a 11-year-old named Rebecca to write to him.

title: NYC pizzeria cocaine ring smashed
description: US and Italian agents dismantle a cocaine trafficking network run from a New York pizzeria, making several arrests.

title: Father defends Brady over report
description: Tom Brady Sr criticises a report claiming his son was "aware" of a plan to under-inflate balls, calling it "Frame-gate".

title: 'Success kid' raises cash for dad
description: Sam Griner, whose image spawned the 'success kid' meme, is using his fame to raise cash to pay for medical treatment for his father.

title: Tribeca festival begins in New York
description: New York's Tribeca Film Festival kicked off on Wednesday with the world premiere of Saturday Night Live documentary, Live from New York!.

title: US Senate passes Iran review bill
description: The US Senate has approved a bill that would give Congress the power to review a nuclear agreement with Iran.

title: VIDEO: Aids can be eradicated, says Elton
description: Sir Elton John says he believes Aids can be eradicated in his lifetime if research funding is continued.

title: VIDEO: Javelin used to extract wobbly tooth
description: Olympic gold medal winner Bryan Clay helped to extract his daughter's wobbly tooth by using one of his javelins.

title: VIDEO: US public 'back Baltimore charges'
description: New data from the Pew Research Center shows that a majority of Americans approve of the charges facing police officers involved in the death of Baltimore's Freddie Gray.

title: VIDEO: Pizza order rescues US hostage
description: A woman in Central Florida used an online pizza order to send a distress signal while being held hostage by her knife-wielding boyfriend.

title: VIDEO: The role of Nasa in desegregation
description: The authors of We Could Not Fail profile some of the first African Americans to work in the US space program

title: VIDEO: 'Some were opposed to US cartoon event'
description: Eyewitness Stephanie Conway tells the BBC some people were opposed to a conference on cartoons of the Prophet Muhammad in a suburb of Dallas, but she saw nothing threatening.

title: VIDEO: Obama pays tribute to shot NY officer
description: US President Barack Obama has paid tribute to New York police officer Brian Moore who has died after being shot in the head.

title: VIDEO: Heavyweight: Manila baker's boxer cake
description: A baker in Manila has made a life-size edible replica of Philippine boxer Manny Pacquiao, as he prepares to fight rival Floyd Mayweather in Las Vegas.

title: VIDEO: Meet the Vegas big fight's 'ring girls'
description: The BBC's Alex South meets the ''ring girls'' who provide an element of glamour in the big fight between Floyd Mayweather and Manny Pacquiao in Las Vegas.

title: US Fed chief warns of share 'danger'
description: Federal Reserve chief Janet Yellen told IMF managing director Christine Lagarde there are "potential dangers" in high stock market valuations.

title: Oculus headset on sale in early 2016
description: Facebook's virtual reality division Oculus reveals when its much anticipated headset will go on sale to the public.

title: Canada country profile
description: Provides an overview of Canada, including key events and facts about the world's second-largest country

title: Puerto Rico profile
description: Provides and overview as well as facts and figures for this small dependency of the United States situated in the Caribbean

title: St Pierre and Miquelon profile
description: Provides an overview of what remains of France's once-extensive possessions in North America

title: United States country profile
description: Provides an overview of the United States, including key events and facts about this superpower

title: Disappointed Albertans look east
description: Alberta election has some residents considering a move

title: VIDEO: New Yorker writer who stopped writing
description: Why did a renowned writer stop publishing for 30 years?

title: Tooth extraction by javelin
description: Daughter 'loved' tooth extraction by javelin

title: 'Political earthquake' in Alberta
description: The night when Canadian politics was turned upside down

title: How dangerous are treadmills?
description: The dangers of using treadmills

title: VIDEO: Anonymous students share class struggle
description: Low-income students share struggles online

title: The Costco heir who became a voice for Baltimore
description: Is it better to call it the Baltimore 'uprising'?
